meta_desc: HSBC Large and Mid Cap Fund Direct   Growth is Large & MidCap Equity mutual fund with risk-reward rating of 3/10. It has track record of 5 years, with three year return of 22.65. Risk is Moderately High
scheme_name: HSBC Large and Mid Cap Fund Direct   Growth
exit_load: Exit load for units in excess of 10% of the investment,1% will be charged for redemption within 1 year.
description: The scheme seeks long term capital growth through investments in both large cap and mid cap stocks.
benchmark_name: NIFTY Large Midcap 250 Total Return Index
super_category: HSBC Large and Mid Cap Fund

analysis.analysis_desc: Consistently higher annualised returns than category average for the past 1Y, 3Y and 5Y

Higher alpha: 5.72 
The fund has generated returns higher than benchmark - NIFTY Large Midcap 250 Total Return Index - in the last 3Y

amc_info.name: HSBC Mutual Fund
amc_info.address: 9-11th Floor,NESCO - IT Park Bldg. 3,Western Express Highway, Goregaon East, Mumbai 400063
amc_info.description: HSBC Mutual Fund started their mutual fund on 27/05/2002 and its managing total assets of Rs. 10,912 Cr. Its ranked at 23 as per total assets at end of 30th Sep 2017.
amc_info.more_description:
HSBC Mutual Fund was established on 27th May 2002 has an asset under management of Rs. 10621.84 crore (As of June 2018)

The asset management company believes in providing well-engineered products to its customers and they also target on developing an adequate solution base for their client.

The motto of the company is to connect customers to companies, so that their investor community may prosper. HSBC claims to work in a goal oriented format to bring about the best possible financial services to its investors. In this regard, HSBC offers a wide array of mutual funds across various categories so that may appeal to investors irrespective of their risk appetite, investment duration and even salary.

With a global presence in 26 locations, HSBC aims to bring about the best possible investment service to retail investors.

category_info.category_helper_text: Invests in stocks as per Contrarian investment strategy
category_info.tax_impact: If you redeem within one year, returns are taxed at 20%. If you redeem after one year, returns exceeding Rs 1.25 lakh in a financial year are taxed at 12.5%.
category_info.description: Contra funds follow Contrarian strategy which means investing in stocks in contrast to the prevailing sentiment. Minimum investment in equity is 65%.
